judges: Before Frazer, C. J., Simpson, Kephart, Schaeeer, Maxey, Drew and Linn, JJ.

opinions.text:
Per Curiam,
Nothing need be added to what is so well expressed in the opinion of Judge Stearne in passing upon and disposing of the questions involved in these two appeals. Upon that opinion the decree of the lower court is affirmed. Costs to be paid by appellants.
opinions.author: Per Curiam,

attorneys: Harry J. Alicer, Jr., with him E. Waring Wilson and Lemuel B. Schofield, for appellant, in No. 303.
Philip Price, with him Barnes, Biddle <& Myers, for appellant, in No. 327.
W. Logan MacOoy, of MacOoy, Evans, Hutchinson & Lewis, for appellees.
casebody.head_matter:

Argued December 6, 1933.

January 2, 1934:
Harry J. Alicer, Jr., with him E. Waring Wilson and Lemuel B. Schofield, for appellant, in No. 303.

W. Logan MacOoy, of MacOoy, Evans, Hutchinson & Lewis, for appellees.
